docs.description:
Burrows-Wheeler Aligner (BWA) is an efficient program that aligns relatively short nucleotide sequences against a long reference sequence such as the human genome.
It implements two algorithms, bwa-short and BWA-SW.
The former works for query sequences shorter than 200bp and the latter for longer sequences up to around 100kbp. Both algorithms do gapped alignment.
They are usually more accurate and faster on queries with low error rates.
docs.short_description: Burrows-Wheeler Aligner (BWA) is an efficient program that aligns relatively short nucleotide sequences against a long reference sequence such as the human genome.
docs.name: BWA
Input File(s)
docs.short_description: Downloads input files to local cluster for further processing.
docs.description: Downloads input files to local cluster for further processing.

docs.name: Output File(s)
docs.short_description: Uploads resulting files from processing cluster to user storage.
docs.description: Uploads resulting files from processing cluster to user storage.

Burrows-Wheeler Aligner (BWA) is an efficient program that aligns relatively short nucleotide sequences against a long reference sequence such as the human genome.
It implements two algorithms, bwa-short and BWA-SW.
The former works for query sequences shorter than 200bp and the latter for longer sequences up to around 100kbp. Both algorithms do gapped alignment.
They are usually more accurate and faster on queries with low error rates.
docs.short_description: Burrows-Wheeler Aligner (BWA) is an efficient program that aligns relatively short nucleotide sequences against a long reference sequence such as the human genome.
docs.name: BWA

inputs.name: Read sequence
inputs.description: Read sequence. If using paired-end reads, provide both to this input but make sure 'paired_end' metadata property is set properly.

inputs.name: FASTA Reference
inputs.description: Reference sequence to which to align the reads

params.description: When disabled, all hits with no more than 'Maximum edit distance' (explicit or implicit) differences will be found. Disabling this mode makes BWA much slower than the default.
params.name: Iterative search

params.description: Specify the read group in a format like '@RG	ID:foo	SM:bar'. This value takes precedence over per-attribute parameters. [default: constructed from per-attribute parameters or inferred from metadata]
params.name: Read group

params.description: Specify the sequencing technology for RG line. [default: inferred from metadata]
params.name: Sequencing technology

params.description: Specify the sample ID for RG line. [default: inferred from metadata]
params.name: Sample

params.description: Specify the library for RG line. [default: inferred from metadata]
params.name: Library

params.description: Specify the platform unit (lane/slide) for RG line. [default: inferred from metadata]
params.name: Platform unit

params.description: Specify the sequencing center for RG line.
params.name: Sequencing center

params.description: Specify the median fragment length for RG line.
params.name: Median fragment length

params.description: Take the first N subsequence as seed. If N is larger than the query sequence, seeding will be disabled. For long reads, this option is typically ranged from 25 to 35 for 'Max edit distance in seed'=2. [default: 32]
params.name: Seed length

params.description: BWA will not search for suboptimal hits with a score lower than (bestScore-misMsc). [default: 3]
params.name: Mismatch penalty

params.description: Length of barcode starting from the 5'-end. When N is positive, the barcode of each read will be trimmed before mapping and will be written at the BC SAM tag. For paired-end reads, the barcode from both ends are concatenated. [default: 0]
params.name: Barcode length

params.description: Gap open penalty [default: 11]
params.name: Gap open penalty

params.description: Disallow an indel within N bp towards the ends [default: 5]
params.name: Indel offset

params.description: Maximum edit distance. In case that 'Fraction of missing alignments' parameter is used, the maximum edit distance is automatically chosen for different read lengths, and this parameter is ignored.
params.name: Maximum edit distance

params.description: Proceed with suboptimal alignments if there are no more than N equally best hits. This parameter only affects paired-end mapping. Increasing this threshold helps to improve the pairing accuracy at the cost of speed, especially for short reads (~32bp). [default: 30]
params.name: Pairing threshold

params.description: Maximum number of gap opens [default: 1]
params.name: Maximum gap opens

params.description: Maximum insert size for a read pair to be considered being mapped properly. Since BWA 0.4.5, this option is only used when there are not enough good alignments to infer the distribution of insert sizes. [default: 500]
params.name: Maximum insert size

params.description: Maximum occurrences of a read for pairing. A read with more occurrences will be treated as a single-end read. Reducing this parameter helps faster pairing. [default: 100000]
params.name: Maximum read occurrences

params.description: Disallow a long deletion within N bp towards the 3'-end [default: 10]
params.name: Long deletion offset

params.description: Maximum number of gap extensions, -1 for k-difference mode (disallowing long gaps) [default: -1 (infinity)]
params.name: Maximum gap extensions

params.description: The fraction of missing alignments given 2% uniform base error rate. In case that this parameter is used, the maximum edit distance is automatically chosen for different read lengths, and 'Maximum edit distance' parameter is ignored. [default: 0.04]
params.name: Fraction of missing alignments

params.description: BWA trims a read down to argmax_x{\sum_{i=x+1}^l(N-q_i)} if q_l<N where l is the original read length. [default: 0]
params.name: Read trimming quality

params.description: Gap extension penalty [default: 4]
params.name: Gap extension penalty

params.description: Maximum number of alignments to output in the XA tag for reads paired properly. If a read has more than N hits, the XA tag will not be written. [default: 3]
params.name: Alternative hits

params.description: Maximum number of alignments to output in the XA tag for disconcordant read pairs (excluding singletons). If a read has more than N hits, the XA tag will not be written. [default: 10]
params.name: Maximum disconcordant alt. hits

params.description: Maximum edit distance in the seed [default: 2]
params.name: Maximum seed edit distance

params.description: When aligning BAMs, specify if it contains paired end reads (True) or single end reads (False)
params.name: Paired end BAM

params.description: Filter Cassava-filtered sequences
params.name: Filter Cassava-filtered sequences

params.description: Maximum entries in the queue
params.name: Maximum entries in the queue

params.description: Log-scaled gap penalty for long deletions
params.name: Log-scaled gap penalty for long deletions

params.description: Set to true if output should be in BAM format.
params.name: Output BAM file

It implements two algorithms, bwa-short and BWA-SW.

They are usually more accurate and faster on queries with low error rates.
